comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content: On July 27, 2011, bmm0623 suggested where this photo was taken; thank you for your efforts to #mapBK!

comment.author: 24469639@N00
comment._content: Exactly 139 years ago, and very topical to see a Brooklyn view. What's it looking like today? I hope you're all pulling through over there.

comment.author: 83979593@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/whatsthatpicture] 
Thanks for asking, whatsthatpicture. This part of Brooklyn wasn't very hard hit, though there was a mountain of downed trees near the south entrance to Prospect Park that gave a sense of how many trees were destroyed.  
Deb Wythe
Digital Lab

comment.author: 24469639@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/brooklyn_museum] I love some of your more mysterious Brooklyn views, when it was nothing more than fields. Like these two, which were taken on this day 26 Nov 1874 (oddly enough one with a fallen tree!):
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/83979593@N00/5832945663] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/83979593@N00/5832945877]
